intro: Obione texana, commonly known as the Texas obione, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the arid regions of Texas. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, grass-like leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Obione texana is considered a vulnerable species.
